meanings.definition: A form of government in which experts in technology and science hold power.
meanings.sent1: In technocracies, scientists and engineers make important decisions for the country.
meanings.sent2: The technocracies of the future may rely heavily on artificial intelligence.
meanings.sent3: The technocracies in charge of the city council decided to implement a robot mayor.
meanings.sent4: The technocracies ruled with the precision of a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The concept of technocracies can be both fascinating and intimidating.

meanings.definition: The people or group of people who hold power in a technocracy.
meanings.sent1: The technocracies were composed of brilliant minds from various scientific fields.
meanings.sent2: Citizens in technocracies often trust the decisions made by experts.
meanings.sent3: The technocracies gathered to discuss the latest advancements in technology over lunch.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the complex world of technocracies with ease.
meanings.sent5: The influence of technocracies can shape the future of society.
